headline: Transgrid: New South Wales’ energy transition now enters the next phase
summary_80w: New South Wales, Australia's most coal-dependent state, will transition from 40% to 90% renewable energy by 2035, according to grid operator Transgrid's latest planning report.

headline: Modular design architecture with smart protection can mitigate C&I battery storage safety concerns
summary_80w: Commercial and industrial (C&I) energy storage can significantly lower electricity costs, increase efficiency, and aid decarbonisation, but customers’ safety concerns must be addressed.

headline: The evolution of BESS offtake deals in Europe
summary_80w: Long-term BESS offtake and PPA deals are clearly on the rise in Europe, but how are they evolving vi-a-vis structures, tenors and regional differences?

headline: Australia opens AU$500 million Battery Breakthrough Initiative
summary_80w: The Australian government has officially launched the AU$500 million Battery Breakthrough Initiative (BBI).

headline: Blueleaf Energy, Chemsain Sustainability pen MoU to deliver 3GW of solar and energy storage in Malaysia
summary_80w: Singaporean renewable energy developer Blueleaf Energy has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Chemsain Sustainability to jointly explore developing a portfolio of up to 3GW of solar PV and battery energy storage systems (BESS) in Malaysia.

headline: SAEL signs 880MW solar PPAs in Gujarat and Punjab
summary_80w: Indian renewable energy company SAEL Industries has signed two 880MW power purchase agreements (PPAs) with the Indian states of Gujarat and Punjab.

headline: Third Pillar Solar looks to build 500MW of floating PV on Texas reservoirs
summary_80w: Specialist floating solar (FPV) developer Third Pillar Solar will examine the potential to develop 500MW of assets on Texas reservoirs.

headline: Scatec revenues hold steady at US$220 million in Q2 2025
summary_80w: Scatec has reported stable financial results in the second quarter of 2025, with revenue holding steady at NOK2.3 billion (US$220 million).

headline: Geronimo Power breaks ground on 125MW solar PV plant in Michigan
summary_80w: Independent power producer Geronimo Power has started construction on a 125MW solar PV plant in the Midwest US state of Michigan.

headline: Australia’s Clean Energy Council appoints new CEO
summary_80w: Australia’s Clean Energy Council has appointed Jackie Trad as its new chief executive officer, following the departure of Kane Thornton.

headline: SolAmerica secures US$100 million through revolving credit facility
summary_80w: Solar and energy storage developer SolAmerica Energy has raised US$100 million through a revolving credit facility with Deutsche Bank.

headline: California county adopts ‘balanced’ BESS zoning, hopes to stop developers seeking state-level approvals
summary_80w: After imposing a moratorium on the development of new battery storage projects in January 2024, officials in Solano County, California, have adopted new zoning standards for the technology.

headline: Duke Energy applies to extend operation of pumped hydro energy storage project in South Carolina
summary_80w: Major US utility company Duke Energy has submitted its final license application to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to extend operation at the Bad Creek Pumped Storage Hydroelectric Station for an additional 50 years.

headline: Minnesota Public Utilities Commission approves state’s first standalone BESS project
summary_80w: The Minnesota Public Utilities Commission (PUC) has approved a site permit for Spearmint Energy’s 150MW/600MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) in Kalmar Township.

headline: Hithium signs 1GWh residential and C&I BESS distribution agreement in Pakistan
summary_80w: Hithium has partnered with The Imperial Electric Company to deliver 1GWh of energy storage across Pakistan's residential and C&I sectors.

headline: Fire testing heats up as Chinese energy storage firms wage ‘extreme safety’ battle
summary_80w: Energy storage system safety is being taken to new levels, as evidenced by the fire testing efforts of Chinese market players, writes Carrie Xiao.

headline: Australia’s AGL Energy dedicates AU$900 million to battery storage as net profit dips 21% year-on-year
summary_80w: AGL Energy has deployed approximately AU$900 million toward BESS and renewables in Australia during the fiscal year ending June 2025.

headline: Australia: Victoria updated Transmission Plan adds new REZ, 200,000 hectares
summary_80w: The Australian government of Victoria has released an amended version of the Victorian Transmission Plan, adding 200,000 hectares of area to develop renewable energy – in addition to 230,000 hectares proposed in the first draft.

headline: After the blackout
summary_80w: Jonathan Touriño Jacobo explores evidence of systemic problems in the Iberian grid and some of the solutions following the blackout.

headline: New Stonepeak Middle East renewables vehicle to be led by ex-Jinko executive
summary_80w: Investment fund Stonepeak has launched a new Middle Eastern renewables platform headed up by a former executive at Jinko Power.
